references: M. Petkovsek et al., "A=B", Peters, p. ix of second printing.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
E. Delaygue, Arithmetic properties of Apery-like numbers, arXiv preprint arXiv:1310.4131, 2013
N. J. A. Sloane, My favorite integer sequences, in Sequences and their Applications (Proceedings of SETA '98).
formula: Sum(C(2 * (n-k), n-k)^2 * C(2 * k, k)^2, k=0..n).G.f.: (4/Pi^2)*EllipticK(4*x^(1/2))^2. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 01 2003a(n) = hypergeom([1/2, 1/2, -n, -n], [1, 1/2-n, 1/2-n], 1) * 4^n * (2n-1)!!^2 / n!^2. - _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Mar 08 2014a(n) ~ 2^(4*n+1) * log(n) / (n*Pi^2) * (1 + (4*log(2) + gamma)/log(n)), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant A001620. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 28 2015
mathematica: a[n_] := (16 (n - 1/2)(2*n^2 - 2*n + 1)a[n - 1] - 256(n - 1)^3 a[n - 2])/n^3; a[0] = 1; a[1] = 8; Array[a, 19, 0] (* Or *)f[n_] := Sum[(Binomial[2 (n - k), n - k] Binomial[2 k, k])^2, {k, 0, n}]; Array[f, 19, 0] (* Or *)lmt = 20; Take[ 4^Range[0, 2 lmt]*CoefficientList[ Series[(4/Pi^2) EllipticK[4 x^(1/2)]^2, {x, 0, lmt}], x^(1/2)], lmt] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)a[n_] := HypergeometricPFQ[{1/2, 1/2, -n, -n}, {1, 1/2-n, 1/2-n}, 1] * 4^n * (2n-1)!!^2 / n!^2 (* _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Mar 08 2014 *)
prog: (Haskell)a036917 n = sum $ map   (\k -> (a007318 (2*n-2*k) (n-k))^2 * (a007318 (2*k) k)^2) [0..n]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 24 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: First formula corrected by _Tito Piezas III_, Oct 19 2010
